thread.title: High school basketball team loses game in worst way possible
thread.title_full: High school basketball team loses game in worst way possible

author: Tyler Schmall
title: High school basketball team loses game in worst way possible
text:
Welp, March Madness has finally arrived.
Arlington High School played Central Christian Academy on Tuesday night (OK, so it was technically February) in an Indiana state tournament.
SEE ALSO: This is what happens when you tie your shoe in the middle of a game
With 0.5 seconds left to go, Arlington had a one point lead with still a free throw to shoot. So they basically had the game in the bag.
But that's when a crucial error occurred. Arlington decided to intentionally miss the second free throw, and....
@espn #SCTop10 full court game winner! pic.twitter.com/uX2mNz0Tzv
— Justin Steele (@Jsteele7777) March 1, 2017
That s cks.
And here's a second angle just for good measure:
Shout out to Central Christian Academy! One of the best buzzer beaters you'll ever see... (via Nick Vincent) pic.twitter.com/7MQIunXnQK
— Dime on UPROXX (@DimeUPROXX) March 2, 2017
The decision to intentionally miss the second free throw is a common one in basketball. This strategy doesn't give the opposing team enough to time to run an inbound play, so by intentionally missing, Arlington was basically forcing Central Christian Academy to try a full-court catch-and-heave. Rarely does this work for the unfortunate team doing the heaving.
But sometimes the Basketball Gods simply want you to lose, and this was, sadly, was one of those times.
Senior Josh Clanton, Central Christian Academy's newest legend, tried to make his famous shot with the pressure off but could not seem to recreate the magic.
Gave Josh Clanton five tries to make it again from 75 feet. Couldn't do it. But he made the one that counted. pic.twitter.com/r0QqEUOk55
— Kyle Neddenriep (@KyleNeddenriep) March 1, 2017
Let this be a lesson: always make your free throws.
BONUS: This parkour robot overlord has 'Terminator' written all over it
